resources module¶

Resources are blobs in the datastore that can contain pages of HTML, stylesheets, images, or templates. A Resource is just like a small file except for a few additional features:

  1. Resources are grouped under ResourceBundles.
  2. Resources can be fetched from the datastore or from files on disk.
  3. We can store localized variants of a resource and select one.
  4. We support compiling and rendering a resource as a Django template.
  5. We cache the fetched, compiled, or rendered result in RAM.

Similar to App Engine’s app versions, there is a concept of an “active bundle” from which resources are obtained. Previewing or releasing a new set of resources is a matter of setting the active bundle.

class resources.RamCache¶
clear()¶
get(key)¶
put(key, value, ttl_seconds)¶
class resources.Resource(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, _from_entity=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: google.appengine.ext.db.Model

Resources are blobs in the datastore that can contain pages of HTML, stylesheets, images, or templates. A Resource is just like a small file except for a few additional features:

  1. Resources are grouped under ResourceBundles.
  2. Resources can be fetched from the datastore or from files on disk.
  3. We can store localized variants of a resource and select one.
  4. We support compiling and rendering a resource as a Django template.
  5. We cache the fetched, compiled, or rendered result in RAM.

The key_name is a resource_name or resource_name + ‘:’ + language_code. All Resource entities should be children of a ResourceBundle.

RESOURCE_DIR = 'resources'¶
cache_seconds¶

A float property.

content¶

A byte string that can be longer than 1500 bytes.

static get(name, bundle_name=None)¶

Fetches a resource, first looking in the datastore, then falling back to a file on disk. Returns None if neither is found.

get_template()¶

Compiles the content of this resource into a Template object.

last_modified¶

The base class of all of our date/time properties.

We handle common operations, like converting between time tuples and datetime instances.

static list_files()¶

Returns a list of the files in the resource directory.

static load_from_file(name)¶

Creates a Resource from a file, or returns None if no such file.

class resources.ResourceBundle(parent=None, key_name=None, _app=None, _from_entity=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: google.appengine.ext.db.Model

Parent entity for a set of resources. The key_name is a bundle name arbitrarily chosen by the admin user who stored the resources.

created¶

The base class of all of our date/time properties.

We handle common operations, like converting between time tuples and datetime instances.

list_resources()¶

Returns a list of the names of resources in this bundle.

resources.clear_caches()¶
resources.get_localized(name, lang, bundle_name=None)¶

Gets the localized (or if none, generic) variant of a Resource from the cache, the datastore, or a file. Returns None if no match is found.

resources.get_rendered(name, lang, extra_key=None, get_vars=<function <lambda>>, cache_seconds=1, bundle_name=None)¶

Gets the rendered content of a Resource from the cache or the datastore. If name is ‘foo.html’, this looks for a Resource named ‘foo.html’ to serve as a plain file, then a Resource named ‘foo.html.template’ to render as a template. Returns None if nothing suitable is found. When rendering a template, this calls get_vars() to obtain a dictionary of template variables. The cache is keyed on bundle_name, name, lang, and extra_key; use extra_key to capture dependencies on template variables).

resources.render_in_lang(template, lang, vars)¶

Renders a template in a given language. We use this to ensure that Django’s idea of the current language matches our cache keys.

resources.set_active_bundle_name(name)¶

Sets the currently active bundle. Unfortunately, this is a global setting because the Django template loader (django_setup.TemplateLoader) is also a global setting, and so far we don’t know a way to pass the bundle name from get_rendered to the template loader.
